data.title: Shakira gets harsh criticism after Copa America's 2024 Final halftime show, fans suspect playback

data.text:
Shakira took the stage amid all the chaos during the preview of the Copa America Final between Argentina and Colombia, and after the first half of the match ended 0-0, Shakira's halftime show was full of augmented reality items that could be perceived from the broadcast.

Fans questioned Shakiras use of playback during her performance

On stage, she performed some of her classics, but some fans noticed that the singer from Barranquilla used playback in most of her songs and used similar choreography to the one she performed when she hosted the Super Bowl.

What was initially announced as a 25-minute show, ended up being a little less, and for many, the Colombian singer's performance was underwhelming, which consisted of only 4 songs, and at some points, the show was cut short.

Which songs did Shakira sing at the halftime show?

The Colombian superstar sang the following four songs.

"Hips Don't Lie"

"Te Felicito"

"TQG"

"Punteria"

Did Shakira use playback during the halftime show?

Many on social media criticized Shakira's show for the apparent use of playback during her performance, as in some songs there was a bit of lip-syncing, and the music sounded exactly like the studio version.

In addition, others noted that it was very similar to the Super Bowl show she gave a few years ago, both in the choreography and the songs she chose for her show.
